author: Grimms
text: A louse and a flea kept house together and were brewing beer in an egg-shell.

author: Grimms
text: Then the little louse fell in and burnt herself.

author: Grimms
text: On this the little flea began to scream loudly.

author: Grimms
text: Then said the little room-door, "Little flea, why art thou screaming?"

author: Grimms
text: "Because the louse has burnt herself."

author: Grimms
text: Then the little door began to creak.

author: Grimms
text: On this a little broom in the corner said, "Why art thou creaking, little door?"

author: Grimms
text: "Have I not reason to creak?"

author: Grimms
text: "The little louse has burnt herself, The little flea is weeping."

author: Grimms
text: So the little broom began to sweep frantically.

author: Grimms
text: Then a little cart passed by and said, "Why art thou sweeping, little broom?"

author: Grimms
text: "Have I not reason to sweep?"

author: Grimms
text: "The little louse has burnt herself, The little flea is weeping,

author: Grimms
text: The little door is creaking."

author: Grimms
text: So the little cart said, "Then I will run," and began to run wildly.

author: Grimms
text: Then said the ash-heap by which it ran, "Why art thou running so, little cart?"

author: Grimms
text: "Have I not reason to run?"

author: Grimms
text: "The little louse has burnt herself, The little flea is weeping,

author: Grimms
text: The little door is creaking, The little broom is sweeping."

author: Grimms
text: The ash-heap said, "Then I will burn furiously," and began to burn in clear flames.

author: Grimms
text: A little tree stood near the ash-heap and said, "Ash-heap, why art thou burning?"

author: Grimms
text: "Have I not reason to burn?"

author: Grimms
text: "The little louse has burnt herself, The little flea is weeping,

author: Grimms
text: The little door is creaking, The little broom is sweeping,

author: Grimms
text: The little cart is running."

author: Grimms
text: The little tree said, "Then I will shake myself," and began to shake herself so that all her leaves fell off; a girl who came up with her water-pitcher saw that, and said, "Little tree, why art thou shaking thyself?"

author: Grimms
text: "Have I not reason to shake myself?"

author: Grimms
text: "The little louse has burnt herself, The little flea is weeping,

author: Grimms
text: The little door is creaking, The little broom is sweeping,

author: Grimms
text: The little cart is running, The little ash-heap is burning."

author: Grimms
text: On this the girl said, "Then I will break my little water-pitcher," and she broke her little water-pitcher.

author: Grimms
text: Then said the little spring from which ran the water, "Girl, why art thou breaking thy water-jug?"

author: Grimms
text: "Have I not reason to break my water-jug?"

author: Grimms
text: "The little louse has burnt herself, The little flea is weeping,

author: Grimms
text: The little door is creaking, The little broom is sweeping,

author: Grimms
text: The little cart is running, The little ash-heap is burning,

author: Grimms
text: The little tree is shaking itself."

author: Grimms
text: "Oh, ho!" said the spring, "then I will begin to flow," and began to flow violently.

author: Grimms
text: And in the water everything was drowned, the girl, the little tree, the little ash-heap, the little cart, the broom, the little door, the little flea, the little louse, all together.
